dimension. This is generally intended as a simple way to restrict
texture sizes for limited graphics cards. When this is greater than
zero, each texture image loaded from a file (but only those loaded from
a file) will be automatically scaled down, if necessary, so that neither
dimension is larger than this value. If this is less than zero, the size
limit is taken from the primary GSG. If this is exactly zero, there is
no limit. max-texture-stages int -1 Set this to a positive integer to limit the number of texture stages
